content:
Diagnosis:	Prostate adenocarcinoma T2N0M0, Gleason score 4+3=7, involving 5/16 cores (maximum length 6mm), initial PSA 19.2

Imaging:	Prostate MRI demonstrates 75ml gland with nodular benign hyperplasia and highly suspicious Likert 5 lesion in left anterior apical region

Comorbidities:	Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (on apixaban), essential hypertension, moderate aortic stenosis under cardiology surveillance, chronic kidney disease stage 3A, previous left total hip replacement 2019, primary hyperparathyroidism awaiting surgery

I am writing to request your specialist opinion regarding this gentleman who presents with newly diagnosed intermediate-risk prostate cancer, currently being evaluated for radical treatment with combined androgen deprivation and radiotherapy. We are awaiting PSMA-PET staging. Of particular concern, he describes progressive fatigue over 4 months with unexplained weight loss of 8kg. He reports early satiety and intermittent epigastric discomfort, though no frank nausea or vomiting. His bowel habit has remained unchanged.

I enclose my recent assessment letter for your reference.
